definition: to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
to hide
footprint/mark/trace/vestige/sign/indication/Taiwan pr. [ji1]

sentences.english: The once powerful figures have also disappeared from the scene one after another.
sentences.chinese: 那些烜赫一時的人物也一個個銷聲匿跡了。

sentences.english: And yet the anger and turmoil of that period never entirely drained away.
sentences.chinese: 但那個時期爆發的怒火和動盪從未完全銷聲匿跡。

sentences.english: The fashion industry would die like an insect in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 時裝業將會像秋後的昆蟲一樣銷聲匿跡。

sentences.english: E. g. 6: During the two previous centuries musical styles went in one era and out of another.
sentences.chinese: 在前兩個世紀，音樂風格時髦一陣，又很快銷聲匿跡。

sentences.english: The rumour had to disappear before facts.
sentences.chinese: 在事實面前謠言只得銷聲匿跡。

sentences.english: Onece the orbs nearby fall into the black hole, they will disappear forever.
sentences.chinese: 附近的天體一旦落入黑洞，就銷聲匿跡，永無蹤影。

definition: to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to hit the big time
to see the light again (idiom); delivered from oppression
to live together in harmony
to remain unmoved
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
a haze of doubts and suspicions
penniless (idiom)
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
ironclad evidence/conclusive proof
to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
political circles
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
